page.title: 01Clandons,E & W Surrey
page.content: East and West Clandon are villages surrounded in the main by open land. They each have a Stately home, both built in 18th centurey, and the churhc in each village has some remaining features from the 13th century. Thereare many houses dating from 18th c. East Clndon remains an unchanged country village and its residents are largely upper middle class business people. A railway station has been built at West Clandon encouraging ribbon development of houses for commuters. This has changed the character of the village. few people work locally and 70% of the residents own cars. The villages conduct separate lives but combine for the Seniors Club run by the red Cross and flourishing Horticultural Society. There is the British Legion Social club for those eligible to join.
